page.title: 02Ecology
page.content: This area rarely suffers extremes of temperature or rainfall seldom having a daytime temp higher than 80f or lower than 32f. It is designated of outstanding landscape value which protects against development. Cover is chiefly grass & deciduous woodland & a number of ponds. Soil varies from clay to sand & a number of sandstone outcrops. Pockets of chalk carry typical wild flowers of scabious harebell & spotted orchid. These are decreasing due to drainage & use of herbicides. Rarieties still exist in the limited wetland eg marsh orchid & spearwort. There is good cover of hedges which means birds & small mammals are plentiful. Some hedges have been removed to facilitate the use of large machinery. There are about l5 miles of footpaths.
